Abstract: The COVID-19 pandemic has precipitated an unprecedented global crisis, challenging the resilience of financial systems and the efficacy of monetary policies worldwide. This paper reflects on the macro-financial stability during the pandemic, with a particular focus on emerging markets. It examines the dual role of monetary policy in stabilizing economies and ensuring financial stability amidst the crisis. The analysis highlights the unique vulnerabilities of emerging markets, including capital flow reversals, currency depreciations, and heightened debt sustainability concerns. Furthermore, the paper discusses the policy responses adopted by central banks and governments to mitigate the economic fallout and safeguard financial systems. It underscores the importance of international cooperation and policy coordination in addressing the global nature of the crisis. The reflections presented aim to contribute to the ongoing discourse on enhancing the resilience of financial systems and formulating effective policy measures in the face of future crises.
